Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Dermaseptin-AC4 (DRP-AC4, Ala-rich; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: Skin Secretion, the Red-Eyed Tree Frog,Agalychnis callidryas, North America (Mexico)  to Central America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (81.5%) toDermaseptin-A3Activity: Active against S. aureus, E. coli (MIC 8 uM), P. aeruginosa, C. albicans (MIC 64 uM),  E. faecalis (MIC 32 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 32 uM), and MRSA (MIC 32 uM). Inhibit biofilm formation of S. aureus, not great in biofilm eradication (MBEC >256 uM).Toxicity: Low level hemolysis at MIC.Structure: Random in aqueous solution and helical in 50% TFE. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Gong Z, Pei X, Ren S, et al. 2020
Literature Information.Title: Identification and Rational Design of a Novel Antibacterial Peptide Dermaseptin-AC From the Skin Secretion of the Red-Eyed Tree Frog Agalychnis callidryas
